title: Grades 6-8: Classical Languages, Level II, Novice Mid to Intermediate Mid Proficiency
subject: Languages Other Than English (2014-)

document.title: Texas Essential Knowledge and Skills for Languages Other Than English

00E9B116AE0242679D636FE84D4E0DD0.description: describe people, objects, or situations orally or in writing with essential details.

CBE3EAD851BA41F3B7DCE68C9FE543E2.description: express and support an opinion or preference orally or in writing; and

2AB2972FE6B64628AA6ED594DB759D89.description: Presentational communication: speaking and writing. The student presents information orally or in writing using a mixture of phrases and simple sentences with appropriate and applicable grammar structures and processes at the specified proficiency levels. The student is expected to:

6231AF453BE44B1EAA88C938B270FA9A.description: identify cultural practices from relevant print, digital, audio, or audiovisual materials.

37E4CE4F42DA453AB936683214DE93FC.description: infer meaning of unfamiliar words or phrases in highly contextualized texts, audio, or audiovisual materials; and

A88B233E4C234DED97D48F6CA1E315E6.description: identify the main idea, theme, and supporting details from fiction or nonfiction texts or audio or audiovisual materials;

2F6706349B7940D49A0EF0CA5BD3DD36.description: demonstrate an understanding of culturally relevant print, digital, audio, or audiovisual materials in classroom contexts;

40C6EF7AB21B469C95F721CDA3987187.description: Interpretive communication: reading and listening. The student comprehends simple connected statements from culturally relevant print, digital, audio, and audiovisual materials as appropriate within contextualized situations and sources. The student uses the interpretive mode in communication with appropriate and applicable grammatical structures and processes at the specified proficiency levels. The student is expected to:

29205EABF01E42CCBF3621D314BF93E2.description: ask and tell others what they need to, should, or must do in spoken or written conversation using appropriate constructions such as the imperative mood, impersonal verbs, or the subjunctive mood.

385DEC739C074BA094E8C86C09BD4A6D.description: express and exchange personal opinions or preferences in spoken or written conversation using simple constructions such as impersonal verbs; and

9BD94A6AC74642BC9FB74BE3E0D5B742.description: ask and respond to questions with simple elaboration in spoken or written conversation;

26A542900BFA49D5AAF3EDE402C3B346.description: Interpersonal communication: speaking and writing. The student negotiates meaning through the spoken and written exchange of information in a variety of contexts. The student uses a mixture of words, phrases, and simple sentences with appropriate and applicable grammar structures and processes at the specified proficiency levels. The student is expected to:

AF83458AC6074976A839726DAB3D494C.description: Classical Languages, Level II, Novice Mid to Intermediate Mid Proficiency
